19:02 [Kühl, in German] They were taken to a forest. 他们被带到了森林里

19:11 some of them women, some of them children. 有些是女性 有些是儿童
19:21 So instead of depersonalizing the execution, 所以处决中没有进行去人格化
19:25 and instead of keeping distance between the killer and the victim, 也没有让枪手和受害者之间保持距离

20:01 where he used to go watch the movies. 电影院老板
20:05 And needless to say, 更不用说这件事的心理伤害

32:00 And he's in love. 他陷入了爱情

34:00 We have to think about what the relationship is 我们必须思考个人和国家

34:25 These individuals, even if they share the ideology of the state 这些个人 就算跟国家有着相同的意识形态
34:31 for whom they are actors or for whom they are instruments, 对国家来说 他们是执行者 他们是工具
34:35 um, when the state no longer holds power, 当国家不再拥有权力的时候
34:39 uh, when governments change, 当政府更换的时候
34:41 they no longer act, or they no longer have a raison d'être 他们不再行动了 也不再有理由这样做了
34:45 to participate in the violence of the state. 去参与国家的暴力
34:48 And this is one of the reasons, I think, understanding perpetrators is vital 我觉得这是其中一个原因 理解行凶者很重要

35:01 [narrator] The German Reich before the war. 战前的德意志帝国
